definition: to draw (e.g. a bow)/to pull/to stretch sth/to extend/to lengthen/to involve or implicate in/to attract/to lead/to guide/to leave/to provide evidence or justification for/old unit of distance equal to 10 丈[zhang4], one-thirtieth of a km or 33.33 meters

sentences.english: Let Nikon's Laser Rangefinders lead the way to a better game.
sentences.chinese: 讓尼康的激光測距儀引路一個更好的遊戲。

sentences.english: Xiu Han Dynasty by Wang Mang to kill this golden rooster lead the way by which name.
sentences.chinese: 因西漢末年劉秀遭王莽追殺到此金雞引路而名。

sentences.english: Graves are visited and fires might be lit to guide the spirits home.
sentences.chinese: 人們會去墳上上墳並給點起火把給回家的靈魂引路。

sentences.english: He guided the man through the streets to the station.
sentences.chinese: 他給那個人引路穿過街道到達車站。

sentences.english: A guide dog can lead its blind owner.
sentences.chinese: 導盲犬可以爲盲主人引路。

sentences.english: Poverty is part of what will guide you around the island.
sentences.chinese: 在這個島上，貧窮是一種路標，會爲你引路。

sentences.english: Itss never occurred to me that bats are really guided by their ears.
sentences.chinese: 我從未想到蝙蝠居然是靠耳朵引路的。

sentences.english: Kenya is trying to lead the way.
sentences.chinese: 而肯尼亞正試圖做這方面的引路人。

sentences.english: Parents need to teach and guide their children by being leaders.
sentences.chinese: 做爲引路人父母親需要傳授和引導孩子。

definition: to lead the way/to guide/to show the way/fig. to instruct
to open up a path/to make one's way through/to construct a road/(electricity) open circuit
to pass on a story/to communicate a message
to blindly follow suit (idiom)/to imitate slavishly/to do what everyone else is doing
to come to a stand/to stop
